greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: For p=prime(n), a(n) = the number of primes q such that q-1 divides p-1.
comment: For many primes p, there are only 3 primes (2,3,p) such that q-1|p-1. See A092307 for a list of those primes.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
example: a(12)=7 because for prime(12)=37 there are seven primes q={2, 3, 5, 7, 13, 19, 37} such that q-1 divides 36.
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Feb 12 2004
